meanings.definition: To use money, resources, etc. carefully and without wasting them.
meanings.sent1: She is economising by buying only what she needs.
meanings.sent2: The family is economising by turning off lights when not in use.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was economising its nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: He was economising his energy for the final sprint.
meanings.sent5: Economising on water during a drought is crucial for conservation.

meanings.definition: To reduce the amount of money, time, or effort that is used.
meanings.sent1: By carpooling, they are economising on fuel costs.
meanings.sent2: The company is economising on office supplies to cut expenses.
meanings.sent3: The magician was economising his tricks for the grand finale.
meanings.sent4: She was economising her words to make a stronger impact.
meanings.sent5: Economising on unnecessary meetings can increase productivity.

meanings.definition: To save money by spending it carefully.
meanings.sent1: They are economising by cooking meals at home instead of eating out.
meanings.sent2: She is economising by buying second-hand clothes.
meanings.sent3: The clown was economising his jokes for the big show.
meanings.sent4: He was economising his allowance to buy a new bike.
meanings.sent5: Economising on groceries can lead to significant savings over time.
